content.description:
A student conducts an experiment to determine the percentage of silver in an alloy by first reacting the alloy with nitric acid. The student then precipitates the <math alttext="A g with a positive 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> by adding excess <math alttext="N a C l aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> to form <math alttext="A g C l solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AgCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> according to the equation.

<math alttext="A g with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus C l with a negative 1 charge aqueous, react to produce A g C l solid" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>Ag</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>+</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mtext>(</mtext> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mtext>)</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>Cl</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mtext>(</mtext> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mtext>)</mtext> <mo>→</mo> <mtext>AgCl</mtext> <mtext>(</mtext> <mi>s</mi> <mtext>)</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

The precipitate is filtered, dried, and weighed.
content.question: Which of the following indicates the effect on the calculated percentage of silver if the precipitate was not dried completely before weighing it, and explains why?

choices.label: The calculated percentage is too low because the additional water will cause a significant quantity of the <math alttext="A g C l solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AgCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> to dissolve and wash through the filter paper.

The calculated percentage is too low because water has a significantly lower molar mass than <math alttext="A g C l solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AgCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, which reduces the average mass of the precipitate.

The calculated percentage is the same because the additional water does not affect the mass of the alloy, and the student will react the same mass of <math alttext="A g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> regardless.

The calculated percentage is too high because the additional water adds mass to the <math alttext="A g C l solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AgCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the student will calculate a higher mass of <math alttext="A g" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow></math> in the sample.

content.answer: The calculated percentage is too high because the additional water adds mass to the <math alttext="A g C l solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AgCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the student will calculate a higher mass of <math alttext="A g" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow></math> in the sample.

skill.text: 6.G: Explain how potential sources of experimental error may affect the experimental results.
